title: Mt. Roastmore
description: The legends immortalized in roast. Pre-generated cards for famous tech leaders.
disclaimer: These are fictional roasts for entertainment purposes only.

cards.name: Brian Chesky
cards.title: CEO & Co-founder
cards.archetypeDescription: Believes every problem can be solved with better typography and a 47-slide deck about 'belonging'

moves.name: Founder Mode Activate
moves.effect: Bypasses all middle management

moves.name: Pixel Perfect Rage
moves.effect: Redesigns opponent's entire product roadmap

moves.name: Snow White Strategy
moves.effect: Storyboards the competition into oblivion

cards.flavor: Once redesigned an air mattress into a $100B company. Still thinks he could've made the mattress better.
cards.bangerQuote: Your Figma skills are not a substitute for a business model, but damn if Brian didn't prove otherwise.
roastBullets: Turned 'strangers sleeping in your house' from a horror movie plot into a $100B company
Has definitely fired someone over font kerning
The only CEO who treats every all-hands like a TED talk about the meaning of human connection
Invented 'Founder Mode' because 'micromanaging with charisma' didn't fit on the blog post title

cards.name: Demis Hassabis
cards.title: CEO & Co-founder
cards.archetypeDescription: Solving intelligence so he can finally have someone smart enough to talk to

moves.name: Chess Grandmaster Stare
moves.effect: Makes opponent question their IQ

moves.name: Nobel Prize Drop
moves.effect: Stuns all critics for 3 turns

moves.name: AlphaFold Flex
moves.effect: Solves opponent's entire industry

cards.flavor: Built an AI that beat Go champions, solved protein folding, and still somehow has to explain to his parents what he does.
cards.bangerQuote: Won a Nobel Prize for AI and still gets asked 'but can it write my emails?' at dinner parties.
cards.naturalRival: Anyone who says 'AGI is just hype'
roastBullets: Casually revolutionized biology between chess tournaments
Has a Nobel Prize and a Nature paper but LinkedIn still suggests he 'complete his profile'
The only person whose 'I was a child prodigy' story is somehow underselling it
Solved protein folding but still can't solve why Google keeps killing his favorite products

cards.name: Lenny Rachitsky
cards.title: Newsletter Guy
cards.archetypeDescription: Turned 'I got laid off from Airbnb' into a media empire by asking other PMs about their frameworks

moves.name: Podcast Plug
moves.effect: Gains 10K subscribers

moves.name: Framework Overload
moves.effect: Buries opponent in 2x2 matrices

moves.name: Benchmark Blast
moves.effect: Makes opponent feel inadequate about their metrics

cards.flavor: Interviewed every PM who ever shipped anything, synthesized it into frameworks, and now every PM sounds exactly the same. You're welcome.
cards.bangerQuote: Made more money asking 'what metrics do you track?' than most PMs make actually tracking metrics.
roastBullets: Became the most influential PM by... not being a PM anymore
Has asked 'what's your framework for X' so many times it's now his actual personality
The only person who can make 'I aggregate other people's insights' sound like thought leadership
Proof that the best career move in product is to stop doing product and just talk about it

cards.name: Reid Hoffman
cards.title: Partner & LinkedIn Guy
cards.archetypeDescription: Built the world's largest professional cringe repository and somehow made billions

moves.name: LinkedIn Connection
moves.effect: Forces opponent to accept unwanted networking request

moves.name: Board Seat Shuffle
moves.effect: Appears on opponent's cap table

moves.name: Blitzscaling Bomb
moves.effect: Burns cash faster than opponent can react

cards.flavor: Created a platform where people unironically write 'I'm humbled to announce' and it's worth more than most countries.
cards.bangerQuote: Invented the place where your weird uncle posts motivational quotes next to crypto scams, and VCs call it 'professional networking'.
roastBullets: Made a website for job hunting and somehow it became a platform for people to write 5-paragraph posts about being fired
The godfather of 'agree?' posts
Blitzscaled his way through every ethical question by just going faster
Wrote a book about networks and then invested in AI that might make networks obsolete

cards.name: Justin Luk
cards.title: PM / Indie Hacker
cards.archetypeDescription: Has 47 side projects, 3 users (all his mom), and calls himself a 'founder'

moves.name: Scope Creep Strike
moves.effect: Adds 'just one more thing' to any project

moves.name: Weekend Deploy
moves.effect: Ships feature nobody asked for

moves.name: Hacker News Hype
moves.effect: Gets 100 upvotes, 0 signups

cards.flavor: Spends more time setting up the perfect dev environment than actually building products. The README is always immaculate though.
cards.bangerQuote: Built a roast app instead of doing his actual job. Honestly, respect.
cards.naturalRival: That guy who shipped the same idea but with VC funding
roastBullets: Portfolio website lists 12 projects, 11 are 'currently in stealth mode' (abandoned)
Bio says 'building in public' but the public is just his Twitter followers who are also building in public
The Venn diagram of 'things Justin has shipped' and 'things with users' is two separate circles
Created PM Roast to roast others, didn't realize the algorithm would roast him back

cards.name: Elon Musk
cards.title: Chief Twit / Technoking
cards.archetypeDescription: Runs 5 companies, posts at 3am, and somehow convinced people that sleeping at the office is sigma behavior

moves.name: 3AM Tweet Storm
moves.effect: Tanks own stock price, confuses everyone

moves.name: Mass Layoff
moves.effect: Reduces opponent's team by 80%

moves.name: First Principles Rant
moves.effect: Makes opponent question everything they know

cards.flavor: The only man who can mass layoff an entire company and have people thank him for it.
cards.bangerQuote: Bought Twitter to fix free speech, turned it into the world's most expensive shitposting platform.
cards.naturalRival: The SEC, sleep, and anyone who asks about Cybertruck windows
roastBullets: Paid $44 billion for a website, immediately made it worth $12 billion, called it a win
Has 11 kids but still finds time to post memes at 2am like a teenager
Promised self-driving cars by 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024... any day now
The only CEO whose HR strategy is 'tweet something wild and see who quits'

cards.name: Mark Zuckerberg
cards.title: CEO & Founder
cards.archetypeDescription: Spent $50B trying to make people wear VR headsets to attend meetings they already hate

moves.name: Congressional Testimony
moves.effect: Drinks water robotically, survives another hearing

moves.name: Privacy Pivot
moves.effect: Harvests opponent's data while apologizing

moves.name: Metaverse Rebrand
moves.effect: Changes company name, nothing else changes

cards.flavor: Started by rating college girls, now rates your grandma's engagement metrics.
cards.bangerQuote: Convinced 3 billion people to give him their data, then wondered why they don't trust him.
cards.naturalRival: Apple's privacy features and anyone who asks him to smile naturally
roastBullets: Renamed the company 'Meta' so people would stop calling him the Facebook guy. It didn't work.
His Senate testimony water-drinking technique has been studied by robots learning human behavior
Spent more on the metaverse than NASA's entire annual budget, created Wii avatars with legs
The only billionaire who looks more comfortable fighting in a cage than making small talk

cards.name: Dario Amodei
cards.title: CEO & Co-founder
cards.archetypeDescription: Left OpenAI because it wasn't safe enough, immediately built an even more powerful AI

moves.name: Safety Theater
moves.effect: Publishes 50-page paper explaining why this is fine

moves.name: Constitutional AI
moves.effect: Makes opponent's AI politely refuse to compete

moves.name: Scaling Laws Lecture
moves.effect: Bores opponent into submission with math

cards.flavor: The 'responsible AI' guy who keeps making AI more powerful. The cognitive dissonance is a feature, not a bug.
cards.bangerQuote: We're building the most powerful AI in history, but don't worry, we wrote a constitution for it.
cards.naturalRival: OpenAI's marketing budget and anyone who ships without a safety review
roastBullets: Left OpenAI over safety concerns, raised $7B to build something even more capable. Make it make sense.
Writes blog posts about AI risk while his company races to build AGI. The irony writes itself.
Has the energy of a physics professor who's seen the equations and knows we're all doomed
Named his AI 'Claude' because 'Definitely Not Skynet' was already taken

cards.name: Jack Dorsey
cards.title: Former CEO & Founder
cards.archetypeDescription: Meditates for 2 hours daily while his platforms burn. Namaste.

moves.name: Edit Button Denial
moves.effect: Refuses to add obvious feature for 15 years

moves.name: Silent Retreat
moves.effect: Disappears for a month, company continues without noticing

moves.name: Bitcoin Maximalism
moves.effect: Converts opponent's treasury to BTC

cards.flavor: Built a platform for free speech, then spent a decade trying to figure out what that means.
cards.bangerQuote: Ran two public companies part-time while doing ice baths and fasting. Peak Silicon Valley monk energy.
cards.naturalRival: Anyone who asks why Twitter didn't have an edit button for 16 years
roastBullets: Was CEO of two companies simultaneously and both somehow felt neglected
His content moderation strategy was 'meditate on it and hope it goes away'
Sold Twitter to Elon, then spent the next year subtweeting about how it's being run
Walks to work barefoot, eats one meal a day, and wonders why people think he's out of touch

cards.name: Nikita Bier
cards.title: Serial App Flipper
cards.archetypeDescription: Has sold more apps to Facebook than most people have downloaded

moves.name: Gen Z Decoder
moves.effect: Understands what teens want before they do

moves.name: Viral Loop Deploy
moves.effect: App spreads through every high school in America

moves.name: Acqui-hire Bait
moves.effect: Gets bought before having to figure out monetization

cards.flavor: The only person who's figured out that the real product is the acquisition, not the app.
cards.bangerQuote: Built two apps, sold both to Big Tech, and made it look easy. The rest of us are just playing checkers.
cards.naturalRival: App Store reviewers and anyone who asks about DAU after month 3
roastBullets: Has a better exit-to-effort ratio than anyone in Silicon Valley history
Builds apps for teens, sells to Facebook, watches them die. Rinse and repeat.
His growth hack is making apps so viral that Big Tech has to buy them to understand young people
The only founder whose business model is literally 'get acquired before we have to make money'
